page.title: 06TRANSPORT
page.content: Conwy is a bridging town.There are three forms of transport in the Conwy area.There is a mainline railway and the A55 road to Holyhead passes through the town.There is also a small quay where fishing boats and other small craft operate. Although there is no railway station at present in Conwy there is one over the river in Llandudno Junction where there is a branch to Llandudno. Bus services run frequently through Conwy to many major towns in the locality. In Conwy on the quay, boat trips run up and down the river giving scenic views of the surrounding area.Conwy has two car parks but in the summer there is nowhere to park and there is terrible traffic congestion. Douglas Roberts.
